titleStmt.title: SII 12.202: original edition by V. Venkatasubba Ayyar
No. 202. (A.R. No. 104 of 1921). MĒLPĀḌI, CHITTOOR TALUK AND DISTRICT. ON THE SOUTH WALL OF THE MAṆḌAPA (RIGHT OF ENTRANCE) IN FRONT OF THE CENTRAL SHRINE IN THE SŌMANĀTHĒŚVARA TEMPLE.

summary.p: This inscription of the 17th year registers a remission of a number of specified taxes on the village Marudampākkam for conducting a festival to the god Chōḷēndraśiṅgamuḍaiya-Nāyanār by Amarābharaṇar alias Śīyagaṇgaṉ, who calls himself ‘Lord of Kuvaḷālapura’, ‘descendant of the Gaṅga family’ and ‘lord of the Kāvērī and Nandigiri’. This chief appears to have been a subordinate of Kōpperuñjiṅgadēva and was probably identical with Amarābharaṇaṉ Śīyagaṅgaṉ, the patron of Pavaṇandi (Bhavanandi), the author of the Tamil Grammar Naṉṉūl, who figures in records of Kulōttuṅga-Chōḷa III, dated in the 27th and 34th years;S.I.I. Vol. III, No. 62. See also A.R. Nos. 10 of 1893, 116 of 1922 and 432 of 1928-29. but it has to be mentioned that the interval between the latter date and that of the present epigraph is nearly 48 years, unless we assign the present inscription to Kōpperuñjinga I. Śīyagaṅga was the son of Chōḷēndrasiṁha and was also known as Śiṟaimīṭṭa-perumāḷA.R. Nos. 88 of 1889 and 589 of 1919. and Uttamachōḷa-Gaṅga.A.R. Nos. 551 and 562 of 1906.

From an inscription at Mēlpāḍi itself we know that the ancient name of the Sōmanāthēśvara temple was ChōḷēndrasiṁhēśvaramS.I.I. Vol. III, pp. 22 and 29. and that it was constructed by Rājarāja I in the city of Vīra-Rājāśrayapuram, newly founded by him after cancelling the old surname of Mēṟpāḍi viz. Vīranārāyaṇapuram.A.R. No. 101 of 1921 and Ep. Rep. for 1921, p. 97.
The village Marudambākkam may be identified with the village of the same name in the Walajapet taluk of the North Arcot district.

revisionDesc.change: Further conversion of digital encoding to DHARMA encoding scheme according to EGD (Encoding Guide for Diplomatic Editions)

div.p:
svasti śrī . cakalapuvanaccakkaravattikaḷ kopperuñ
ciṅkatevarkku 10 7vatu śrīmaṟ kuvaḷālapuraparame
śvaraṉ kaṅkakuloṟpavaṉ kāverivallavaṉ nan=ti
kirinātaṉ ciyakaṅkar Olai . marutampākkattu Ūravar ka
ṇṭu viṭai tantatāvatu . taṅkaḷ Ūr tevatāṉa tiruviṭaiyāṭṭa
śrīpaṇṭārapātikku Antarāyappāti Uḷpaṭa Ūraṭaṅkil naṉcai puṉcai
kaṭamaiyum śrīpaṇṭārappāti Uḷpaṭa veṭṭi taṉiyāḷ ciṟupāṭi
kāval kaṇkāṇi Eṭuttukkoṭṭi Arimukkai kaṇakkamikuti Uḷ
paṭṭa pala nellāyaṅkaḷum veṭṭip puṭavai mutaṟtaraṅ kāttikai kā
cuvakai natkācu muḷḷaṭi Iṉavari Erimiṉpāṭṭam Ācuvikaḷperkkaṭamai
Uḷḷiṭṭa pala kācukaṭamaiyum Accuttaṟi paṟaittaṟi cāliyattaṟi Uḷḷiṭṭa ta
ṟikkaṭmai velippayaṟu tarappaṭi Arici tūṇi nilattiṟappukkaṭamai cekkukaṭamai
perkkaṭamai Iruntuparimāṟuvār perkkaṭamaiyum ceṭṭikaḷ vāṇiyar
perkkaṭamaiyum vālmañcāṭikkaṭamaiyum pālikkap pāṭṭamum paḻaṅku
ṭi nikki putukkuṭiyāy Eṟikkoṇṭa maṉṟāṭikaḷ perkkaṭamaiyum po
ṉvari veṇṭukoḷ nallerutu naṟkiṭā kāṇikkai kāttikaippaccai
puṭavai māṭaiyum maṟṟum nām koḷḷum Eppeṟpaṭṭa Aṉaittuvari
kaḷum Uḷpaṭa Ivvūr nāṟpāṟkellaikkum Uḷpaṭṭa melnokkiya
maramum kiḻnokkiya kiṇaṟum Uṭpaṭa patiṉeḻāvatu cittirai mātam
mutal coḷentiraciṅkamuṭaiya nāyanārt tirunāḷukku veṇṭuvaṉa
vatukku veṭṭum Amarāparaṇarāṉa ciyakaṅkaṉ viṭṭeṉ
Digital edition of SII 12.202 by converted to DHARMA conventions by Emmanuel Francis.
